triples.name: Mutation
triples.relevance: Core concept examined; the paper quantifies fitness effects of insertion mutations across genes

triples.name: Escherichia coli
triples.relevance: Experimental organism used for 50,000 generations of evolution study

triples.name: Fitness (biology)
triples.relevance: Quantified measure of reproductive success used to assess mutation effects

triples.name: Evolution
triples.relevance: Primary process being observed; paper tracks changes across 50,000 generations

triples.name: Essential gene
triples.relevance: Individual gene essentiality changes are analyzed as a key outcome variable

triples.name: Mutation
triples.relevance: Paper identifies loss-of-function mutations as predictable targets of selection

triples.name: Structural variation
triples.relevance: Examined as a partial explanation for changes in gene essentiality

triples.name: Exponential distribution
triples.relevance: Beneficial mutations approach this distribution, describing the dynamic nature of fitness effects
